column4: problem- I have no sound in games ... but I hear sound fine on xmms,xine and other desktop programs ..
i bet it's esd blocking the sound device
edit /etc/esound/esd.conf
auto_spawn=1, and spawn_options=-terminate -nobeeps -as 2
ill try - what will it do?
esd will die when nothing requests for it, freeing the sound device. when something wants esd, it will respawn
- thanks!
IIRC you need to at least logout, maybe more. i don't think mine worked before a reboot (i don't know what needs resetting)
nobody knows what sort of file that is. filenames don't necessarily tell much on linux
that's gtksourceview's business
what ? i want to add prolog syntax highlight, thats all :'(
yes, so you make gtksourceview aware of that
how do i do that ?
studdy the xml files in /usr/share/gtksourceview-1.0/language-specs
come on, the files are well structured
that's what they told me on #gnome-hackers when i was lamenting about missing sh support :)
then i started hacking, but somebody beat me to it
there isn't one. you'll write it
im pretty sure there is, since it worked under kde :|
maybe there is a way to make an xml file out of the emacs specification or the one used for kde?
when i started looking at it, i found the vim syntax files easier to understand
